FuncDef:
The ds-lite tcp adjust-mss command sets the maximum segment size (MSS) of packets sent by two interfaces without fragmentation.
The undo ds-lite tcp adjust-mss command deletes the configured MSS of packets sent by two interfaces without fragmentation.
No default MSS is used, which indicates that the length of TCP packets is not limited.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum length of packets to be sent without being fragmented.
The value is an integer ranging from 536 to 1460.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The MSS value defined in TCP specifies the length of a TCP packet to be sent without fragmentation. Two devices exchange SYN packets to negotiate the MSS value for a TCP connection to be established.
Configuration Impact
After the ds-lite tcp adjust-mss command is run in the DS-Lite instance view, a CGN device changes the MSS value in all TCP packets that are processed by DS-Lite. If the negotiated MSS value is greater than the configured , the negotiated MSS value is changed to the configured value. If the negotiated MSS value is smaller than the configured , the negotiated MSS value remains unchanged.
